history.content: It's probably a bit harder than taking CS61A and CS61B concurrently. Chem 1A has a lower workload than 61A but tough curves make the class difficult.
It's probably a bit harder than taking CS61A and CS61B concurrently.

children.subject: I also took that class in fall 2016 and I remember teresa head gordon ended up giving a third of the students a C or worse, which made me sad. Even though the content was kind of meh the curve really ruined the experience for me.

^yeah the curve was not great but still I don’t think it was as bad as say, Bio1B which at one point only gave 5% solid A’s and A+. Chem 1A is usually pretty generous with A/A+, although they don’t give out as many A- to B- as many EECS classes do

I took it with the Head-Gordon’s in Fa16 who are notoriously difficult (supposedly) and I was pretty scared cuz I failed AP Chem in high school. It wasn’t very hard tbh. For example, first exam asked us to draw a quantum wave represented by sin4x so I just drew sin4x. Later, people were screaming like omg he asked us to draw a QUANTUM wave on a freshman exam!!!! I think all the anxious premeds just freaked out too much lol average was like 65% despite the fact that the problems were very straightforward like the sin4x one. Ended up with an A+ by just going to lecture and reviewing slides for the exams (and remember I failed AP chem so I didn’t build off any genius knowledge or anything)

I took 1A in Fall 2017 under the revised curriculum (not the same situation as those in Fall 16 above) and I found it to be easier than AP Chem (by a lot). Maybe this is because I already had AP Chem background knowledge, but the workload was very good (homework was online, graded on completion, optional discussion sections, etc.). There was very little new material, compared to AP Chem, and a lot of hard AP Chem topics weren't covered.

history.content: Hi all, I'm taking Chem 1A and 61B this semester and I have concerns about the workload. Has anyone taken this combination before and could provide some insight? (I've taken AP Chem in high school)
history.subject: Chem 1A and 61B workload
